title: Business Skills (provisional) visas (subclasses 160-165)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Business Skills (provisional) visas (subclasses 160-165) Page Content ​​The following visas are closed to most new applications: the Business Owner (Provisional) visa (subclass 160) the Senior Executive (Provisional) visa (subclass 161) the Investor (Provisional) visa (subclass 162) the State/Territory Sponsored Business Owner (Provisional) visa (subclass 163) the State/Territory Sponsored Senior Executive (Provisional) visa (subclass (164) the State/Territory Sponsored Investor (Provisional) visa (subclass 165). Family members of people who already hold these visas might be able to get the same visa. If you have already applied for one of these visas and it has not yet been decided, you can also add your dependent children or your partner’s dependent children to your visa application until the application is decided. Your eligible family members can apply for this visa when they are in or outside Australia. Someone who applies for this visa must be outside Australia when it is granted unless they held a student visa when they applied. In this case, they can be in or outside Australia when the visa is granted. Visa Applicants This visa is closed to new applicants. Dependent children can be added to the visa application at any time until the application is decided. Details Adding dependent children to a visa application Details Dependent children can be added to the visa application at any time until the application is decided. Dependent children are your or your partner's children who: have not turned 18 years of age, or have turned 18 but cannot work due to incapacity are not married or engaged to be married or have a de facto partner. To add dependent children, complete: Form 47BT — Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa (579KB PDF) Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa The documents listed in the document checklist must be provided with this application form. Applying as a family member Details Family members of someone who already has one of these visas, or who has lodged an application that has not yet been decided, might be able to get the same visa. The family members must be their: partner (married or de facto) dependent children or their partner’s dependent children other dependent relatives. These family members must meet the requirements for including family members in your application . The application must include documentary evidence of their relationship to you.​​ Your family members must be able to show that they meet health and character requirements.​ The family members might also need to take the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) test to show how well they speak, ready and write English. Complete the following form to apply for one of the visas: Form 47BT — Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa (579KB PDF) Submit the documents listed in the document checklist with the application and pay the visa application charge by credit card, money order or bank cheque. Health requirements Details You must meet certain health requirements . However, most applicants for this visa will not be required to complete additional health examinations. Do not arrange a health examination until we ask you to. Character requirements Details You must meet certain character requirements . You must provide a police certificate from each country you have lived in for 12 months or more during the past 10 years after you turned 16 years of age. Debts to the Australian Government Details You must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or have arranged to repay any outstanding debts to the Australian Government before this visa can be granted. Cost Details Business Owner (Subclass 160): Additional applicant charge 18 and over — AUD2,340 Additional applicant charge under 18 — AUD1,170 Senior Executive (Subclass 161): Additional applicant charge 18 and over — AUD2,340 Additional applicant charge under 18 — AUD1,170 Investor (Subclass 162): Additional applicant charge 18 and over — AUD2,340 Additional applicant charge under 18 — AUD1,170 State/Territory Sponsored Business Owner (Subclass 163): Additional applicant charge 18 and over — AUD2,340 Additional applicant charge under 18 — AUD1,170 State/Territory Sponsored Senior Executive (Subclass 164): Additional applicant charge 18 and over — AUD2,340 Additional applicant charge under 18 — AUD1,170 Business Skills (Provisional) (Class UR) (Subclass 165): Additional applicant charge 18 and over — AUD2,340 Additional applicant charge under 18 — AUD1,170 Where to lodge your application Details If you live in the People's Republic of China (PRC), Hong Kong (SAR), Macau (SAR) or Taiwan: send the documents to the Australian Consulate-General Hong Kong If you live elsewhere: send your documents by registered post to our Adelaide office in South Australia - attention Client Services, Adelaide Business Skills Processing Centre. After you have applied Details After you have lodged your application and documents, we will acknowledge that we have received your information Wait for a decision Details Your application could take longer if you need character or health checks (including chest x-rays), if you need to provide more information, or if your application is incomplete. If you applied for this visa outside Australia, do not make arrangements to travel to Australia until you are advised in writing that you have been granted a visa. Provide more information Details You can provide more information to us, at any time until a decision is made on the application. If you want to correct information you provided, use: Form 1023 — Notification of incorrect answer(s) (168KB PDF) We could also ask you for more information. You will have to respond by a set date. After that date, we can make a decision about your application using the information that we have. If another person gives us information that could result in you being refused a visa, we will usually give you the opportunity to comment on the information. You might also be interviewed. If you are asked to attend an interview in person, bring your passport or other identification and any requested documents to the interview. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane. Withdrawing your application See: Withdrawing your application Visa decision Details If the visa is granted, we will let you know: when you can use the visa the visa grant number any conditions attached to the visa.​ If the visa is not granted, we will let you know: why the visa was refused your review rights (if any). Where applicable, your sponsor can apply for the decision to be reviewed the time limit for lodging an appeal. Document checklist Details You need to provide documents to support your application for this visa. We can make a decision using the information you provide when you lodge your application. It is in your interest to provide as much information as possible with your application. Provide certified copies of original documents. Do not include original documents unless we specifically ask for them. Police certificates should be original documents. Documents not in English must be accompanied by accredited English translations. Use this checklist to make sure your application is complete. Forms Details Form 80 - Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF) For any member of your family unit included in the application who is 18 years of age or older and is not your partner: Form 47a — Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over (307KB PDF) Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over (238 kB PDF). For each member of your family unit (child) included in the application who is 16 years of age or older: Form 80 - Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF) Identity Details Certified copies of the biographical pages of the current passports or travel documents of all people included in the application (these are the pages with the holder's photo and personal details and the issue/expiry dates). Two recent passport-sized photographs (45 mm x 35 mm) of each person included in the application. These photographs should be of the head and shoulders only against a plain background. Print the name of the person on the back of each photograph. Certified copies of birth certificates or the family book showing the names of both parents of all your dependent children. If your name has changed or the name of anyone included in your application has changed: a certified copy of evidence of the name change. Family Details If any dependent child included in the application is adopted: certified copies of the adoption papers. If you want to bring a child younger than 18 years of age with you to Australia, and that child’s other parent is not included in the application: documentary evidence that you have the legal right to bring that child to Australia, such as: If you use Form 1229 or a statutory declaration, you will have to attach a certified copy of the other parent’s government-issued identification document (such as a passport or driver's licence) with their photograph and signature. certified copies of official legal documents, such as a court-issued parental responsibility (custody), access or guardianship order statutory declaration giving their permission Form 1229 — Consent to grant an Australian visa to a child under the age of 18 years (276KB PDF) Evidence of financial dependency for all your members of the family unit aged 18 or older: a certified copy of their birth certificate and proof of their relationship to you proof that they live in your household proof that they have been financially dependent on you for at least the 12 months immediately before you lodge your application. Certified copies of marriage certificates or relationship registrations for you and anyone else included in your application, even if they are not joining you in Australia. If you are living in a de facto relationship: independent evidence that your relationship is genuine and continuing (for example, joint bank account statements, billing accounts in joint names or joint ownership of major assets). If you or anyone included in the application has been widowed, divorced or permanently separated: a certified copy of the death certificate, divorce documents, or statutory declaration separation documents. Character requirements Details Police checks for everyone included in the visa application who is 16 years of age or older: an Australian National Police Check for anyone who has spent a cumulative total of 12 months or more in Australia since turning 16 years of age police certificates from each country in which anyone in your application has spent a cumulative total of 12 months or more in the past 10 years since turning 16 years of age. Provide the original certificates and keep a copy for yourself. If anyone included in the application has served in the armed forces of any country: certified copies of their military service record or discharge papers. Health requirements Details Documents to show you meet Australia’s health requirements: Applying outside Australia: medical and x-ray examinations by a panel doctor for you and any family member planning to stay with you in Australia Applying in Australia: evidence of a booking or receipt from Bupa Medical Visa Services for your medical and x-ray examinations. English language ability Details You should have at least functional English. Applicants and dependants (18 years and older) who cannot provide evidence of having at least functional English must pay a second instalment of the visa application charge. If they have less than functional English provide a statement indicating your intention to pay the second visa application charge. To prove you have fu​​nction​al English you must provide evidence of one of the following: You are the holder of a valid passport issued by the United Kingdom, the United States of America, Canada, New Zealand, or the Republic of Ireland and you are a citizen of that country. An International English Language Testing System (IELTS) test result of an average band score of at least 4.5 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, listening and writing. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing. A Test of English as a Foreign Language internet-based Test (TOEFL iBT) test result of a total band score of at least 32 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing. A Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic test result of an overall band score of at least 30 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing. A Cambridge English: Advanced (CAE) test result of an overall band score of at least 147 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening and the test must have been taken on or after 1 January 2015. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing. A positive assessment by an Adult Migrant English Program service provider in Australia that you have functional English. Completed all years of primary education and at least three years of secondary education in an educational institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English. Completed at least five years of secondary education in an institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English. Successfully completed at least one year of full-time study or equivalent part-time study towards a degree, higher degree, diploma, or associate diploma in an institution in Australia and all instructions were in English. Completed a degree, a higher degree, a diploma or a trade certificate that required at least two years of full-time study or training in an institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English. The functional level of the Australian Assessment of Communicative English Skills (ACCESS) test certified by the relevant testing body. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing. Visa holders Details This information is for people who have already been granted one of the following visas: the Business Owner (Provisional) visa (subclass 160) the Senior Executive (Provisional) visa (subclass 161) the Investor (Provisional) visa (subclass 162) the State/Territory Sponsored Business Owner (Provisional) visa (subclass 163) the State/Territory Sponsored Senior Executive (Provisional) visa (subclass 164) the State/Territory Sponsored Investor (Provisional) visa (subclass 165). It explains your rights and obligations. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. How long your visa lasts Details If you are outside Australia when the visa is granted, you will need to enter Australia by a specified date. The visa is usually valid for four years from the date specified for your first entry to Australia. What your visa lets you do Details This visa allows you and any family members who have been granted this visa to: live, work and study in Australia apply for permanent residence (if you are eligible) travel in and out of Australia any number of times as long as the visa is valid. You cannot access Medicare, family assistance or social security benefits. Your obligations Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. You might also need to comply with the following conditions: If condition 8515 is attached to your visa you must not marry or enter into a de facto relationship before you enter Australia If condition 8502 is attached to your visa you must not enter Australia before the person specified has entered Australia. Business Owner, State/Territory Sponsored Business Owner, Senior Executive and State/Territory Sponsored Senior Executive provisional visa holders Details You need to provide valuable input into the Australian economy. You must: obtain and maintain substantial ownership interest in a business in Australia participate, at a senior level, in the day-to-day management and decision-making of that business. In the business, it is expected that you will do at least one of the following: develop business links with international markets create or maintain employment in Australia export Australian goods produce goods or services that would otherwise be imported introduce new or improved technology add to commercial activity and competitiveness within the Australian economy. A failure to meet these obligations while holding a Business Skills (Provisional) visa may impact adversely upon any late application for a Business Skills (Residence) visa. Holders of these visas may be asked to complete a monitoring survey to provide us with information about any business activities undertaken in Australia. This assists in reporting on outcomes of the Business Skills category. Investor and State/Territory Investor visa holders Details Applicants for Investor visas must maintain their Designated Investment for a four year term. Failure to do so may result in visa cancellation. Holders of these visas may be asked to complete a monitoring survey to provide us with information about any business activities undertaken in Australia. This assists in reporting on outcomes of the Business Skills category.

# Business Skills (provisional) visas (subclasses 160-165)

Business Skills (provisional) visas (subclasses 160-165)
Page Content

​​The following visas are closed to most new applications:

​​The following visas are closed to most new applications:
- the Business Owner (Provisional) visa (subclass 160)
the Business Owner (Provisional) visa (subclass 160)
- the Senior Executive (Provisional) visa (subclass 161)
the Senior Executive (Provisional) visa (subclass 161)

the Investor (Provisional) visa (subclass 162)

the State/Territory Sponsored Business Owner (Provisional) visa (subclass 163)

the State/Territory Sponsored Senior Executive (Provisional) visa (subclass (164)

the State/Territory Sponsored Investor (Provisional) visa (subclass 165).

Family members of people who already hold these visas might be able to get the same visa.

Family members of people who already hold these visas might be able to get the same visa.

If you have already applied for one of these visas and it has not yet been decided, you can also add your dependent children or your partner’s dependent children to your visa application until the application is decided.

If you have already applied for one of these visas and it has not yet been decided, you can also add your dependent children or your partner’s dependent children to your visa application until the application is decided.

Your eligible family members can apply for this visa when they are in or outside Australia.

Your eligible family members can apply for this visa when they are in or outside Australia.

Someone who applies for this visa must be outside Australia when it is granted unless they held a student visa when they applied. In this case, they can be in or outside Australia when the visa is granted.

Someone who applies for this visa must be outside Australia when it is granted unless they held a student visa when they applied. In this case, they can be in or outside Australia when the visa is granted.

## Visa Applicants

Visa Applicants

This visa is closed to new applicants. Dependent children can be added to the visa application at any time until the application is decided.

Adding dependent children to a visa application
Details

Dependent children can be added to the visa application at any time until the application is decided. Dependent children are your or your partner's children who:

- have not turned 18 years of age, or have turned 18 but cannot work due to incapacity
have not turned 18 years of age, or have turned 18 but cannot work due to incapacity
- are not married or engaged to be married or have  a de facto partner.
are not married or engaged to be married or have  a de facto partner.

To add dependent children, complete:

Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa

The documents listed in the document checklist must be provided with this application form.

The documents listed in the document checklist must be provided with this application form.

### Applying as a family member

Applying as a family member
Details

Family members of someone who already has one of these visas, or who has lodged an application that has not yet been decided, might be able to get the same visa. The family members must be their:

Family members of someone who already has one of these visas, or who has lodged an application that has not yet been decided, might be able to get the same visa. The family members must be their:
- partner (married or de facto)
partner (married or de facto)
- dependent children or their partner’s dependent children
dependent children or their partner’s dependent children
- other dependent relatives.
other dependent relatives.

These family members must meet the requirements forincluding family members in your application. The application must include documentary evidence of their relationship to you.​​

These family members must meet the requirements for
including family members in your application
. The application must include documentary evidence of their relationship to you.​​

Your family members must be able to show that they meethealthandcharacterrequirements.​

Your family members must be able to show that they meet
health
and
character
requirements.​

The family members might also need to take the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) test to show how well they speak, ready and write English.

The family members might also need to take the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) test to show how well they speak, ready and write English.

Complete the following form to apply for one of the visas:

Complete the following form to apply for one of the visas:
- Form 47BT — Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa (579KB PDF)
Form 47BT — Application for a Business Skills (provisional) visa (579KB PDF)

Submit the documents listed in the document checklist with the application and pay the visa application charge by credit card, money order or bank cheque.

Submit the documents listed in the document checklist with the application and pay the visa application charge by credit card, money order or bank cheque.

#### Health requirements

Health requirements
Details

You must meet certainhealth requirements. However, most applicants for this visa will not be required to complete additional health examinations. Do not arrange a health examination until we ask you to.

You must meet certain
health requirements
. However, most applicants for this visa will not be required to complete additional health examinations. Do not arrange a health examination until we ask you to.

#### Character requirements

Character requirements
Details

You must meet certaincharacter requirements. You must provide a police certificate from each country you have lived in for 12 months or more during the past 10 years after you turned 16 years of age.

You must meet certain
character requirements
. You must provide a police certificate from each country you have lived in for 12 months or more during the past 10 years after you turned 16 years of age.

#### Debts to the Australian Government

Debts to the Australian Government
Details

You must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or have arranged to repay any outstanding debts to the Australian Government before this visa can be granted.

You must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or have arranged to repay any outstanding debts to the Australian Government before this visa can be granted.

### Where to lodge your application

Where to lodge your application
Details
- If you live in the People's Republic of China (PRC), Hong Kong (SAR), Macau (SAR) or Taiwan: send the documents to theAustralian Consulate-General Hong Kong
If you live in the People's Republic of China (PRC), Hong Kong (SAR), Macau (SAR) or Taiwan: send the documents to the
Australian Consulate-General Hong Kong
- If you live elsewhere: send your documents by registered post to ourAdelaide officein South Australia - attention Client Services, Adelaide Business Skills Processing Centre.
If you live elsewhere: send your documents by registered post to our
Adelaide office
in South Australia - attention Client Services, Adelaide Business Skills Processing Centre.

### After you have applied

After you have applied
Details

After you have lodged your application and documents, we will acknowledge that we have received your information

After you have lodged your application and documents, we will acknowledge that we have received your information

#### Wait for a decision

Wait for a decision
Details

Your application could take longer if you need character or health checks (including chest x-rays), if you need to provide more information, or if your application is incomplete.

Your application could take longer if you need character or health checks (including chest x-rays), if you need to provide more information, or if your application is incomplete.

If you applied for this visa outside Australia, do not make arrangements to travel to Australia until you are advised in writing that you have been granted a visa.

If you applied for this visa outside Australia, do not make arrangements to travel to Australia until you are advised in writing that you have been granted a visa.

#### Provide more information

Provide more information
Details

You can provide more information to us, at any time until a decision is made on the application. If you want to correct information you provided, use:

You can provide more information to us, at any time until a decision is made on the application. If you want to correct information you provided, use:
- Form 1023 — Notification of incorrect answer(s)  (168KB PDF)
Form 1023 — Notification of incorrect answer(s)  (168KB PDF)

We could also ask you for more information. You will have to respond by a set date. After that date, we can make a decision about your application using the information that we have.

We could also ask you for more information. You will have to respond by a set date. After that date, we can make a decision about your application using the information that we have.

If another person gives us information that could result in you being refused a visa, we will usually give you the opportunity to comment on the information.

If another person gives us information that could result in you being refused a visa, we will usually give you the opportunity to comment on the information.

You might also be interviewed. If you are asked to attend an interview in person, bring your passport or other identification and any requested documents to the interview.

You might also be interviewed. If you are asked to attend an interview in person, bring your passport or other identification and any requested documents to the interview.

#### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how to let us know if there is achange in your situation.

See how to let us know if there is a
change in your situation
.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

#### Withdrawing your application

Withdrawing your application

See:Withdrawing your application

See:
Withdrawing your application

### Visa decision

Visa decision
Details

If the visa is granted, we will let you know:

If the visa is granted, we will let you know:
- when you can use the visa
when you can use the visa
- the visa grant number
the visa grant number
- any conditions attached to the visa.​
any conditions attached to the visa.​

If the visa is not granted, we will let you know:

If the visa is not granted, we will let you know:
- why the visa was refused
why the visa was refused
- your review rights (if any). Where applicable, your sponsor can apply for the decision to be reviewed
your review rights (if any). Where applicable, your sponsor can apply for the decision to be reviewed
- the time limit for lodging an appeal.
the time limit for lodging an appeal.

### Document checklist

Document checklist
Details

You need to provide documents to support your application for this visa. We can make a decision using the information you provide when you lodge your application. It is in your interest to provide as much information as possible with your application.

You need to provide documents to support your application for this visa. We can make a decision using the information you provide when you lodge your application. It is in your interest to provide as much information as possible with your application.

Provide certified copies of original documents. Do not include original documents unless we specifically ask for them. Police certificates should be original documents. Documents not in English must be accompanied by accredited English translations.

Provide certified copies of original documents. Do not include original documents unless we specifically ask for them. Police certificates should be original documents. Documents not in English must be accompanied by accredited English translations.

Use this checklist to make sure your application is complete.

Use this checklist to make sure your application is complete.

#### Forms

Forms
Details
- Form 80 - Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF)
Form 80 - Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF)
- For any member of your family unit included in the application who is 18 years of age or older and is not your partner:Form 47a — Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over (307KB PDF)Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over(238 kB PDF).
For any member of your family unit included in the application who is 18 years of age or older and is not your partner:
- Form 47a — Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over (307KB PDF)Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over(238 kB PDF).
Form 47a — Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over (307KB PDF)
Details of child or other dependent family member aged 18 years or over
(238 kB PDF).
- For each member of your family unit (child) included in the application who is 16 years of age or older:Form 80 - Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF).
For each member of your family unit (child) included in the application who is 16 years of age or older:
- Form 80 - Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF).
Form 80 - Personal particulars for assessment including character assessment (596KB PDF)
.

#### Identity

Identity
Details
- Certified copies of the biographical pages of the current passports or travel documents of all people included in the application (these are the pages with the holder's photo and personal details and the issue/expiry dates).
Certified copies of the biographical pages of the current passports or travel documents of all people included in the application (these are the pages with the holder's photo and personal details and the issue/expiry dates).
- Two recent passport-sized photographs (45 mm x 35 mm) of each person included in the application.These photographs should be of the head and shoulders only against a plain background.Print the name of the person on the back of each photograph.
Two recent passport-sized photographs (45 mm x 35 mm) of each person included in the application.
- These photographs should be of the head and shoulders only against a plain background.
These photographs should be of the head and shoulders only against a plain background.
- Print the name of the person on the back of each photograph.
Print the name of the person on the back of each photograph.
- Certified copies of birth certificates or the family book showing the names of both parents of all your dependent children.
Certified copies of birth certificates or the family book showing the names of both parents of all your dependent children.
- If your name has changed or the name of anyone included in your application has changed: a certified copy of evidence of the name change.
If your name has changed or the name of anyone included in your application has changed: a certified copy of evidence of the name change.

#### Family

Family
Details
- If any dependent child included in the application is adopted: certified copies of the adoption papers.
If any dependent child included in the application is adopted: certified copies of the adoption papers.

#### English language ability

English language ability
Details

You should have at least functional English.

You should have at least functional English.

Applicants and dependants (18 years and older) who cannot provide evidence of having at least functional English must pay a second instalment of the visa application charge.

Applicants and dependants (18 years and older) who cannot provide evidence of having at least functional English must pay a second instalment of the visa application charge.

If they have less than functional English provide a statement indicating your intention to pay the second visa application charge.

If they have less than functional English provide a statement indicating your intention to pay the second visa application charge.

To prove you have fu​​nction​al English you must provide evidence of one of the following:

To prove you have fu​​nction​al English you must provide evidence of one of the following:
- You are the holder of a valid passport issued by the United Kingdom, the United States of America, Canada, New Zealand, or the Republic of Ireland and you are a citizen of that country.
You are the holder of a valid passport issued by the United Kingdom, the United States of America, Canada, New Zealand, or the Republic of Ireland and you are a citizen of that country.
- An International English Language Testing System (IELTS) test result of an average band score of at least 4.5 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, listening and writing. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
An International English Language Testing System (IELTS) test result of an average band score of at least 4.5 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, listening and writing. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
- A Test of English as a Foreign Language internet-based Test (TOEFL iBT) test result of a total band score of at least 32 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
A Test of English as a Foreign Language internet-based Test (TOEFL iBT) test result of a total band score of at least 32 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
- A Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic test result of an overall band score of at least 30 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
A Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic test result of an overall band score of at least 30 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
- A Cambridge English: Advanced (CAE) test result of an overall band score of at least 147 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening and the test must have been taken on or after 1 January 2015. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
A Cambridge English: Advanced (CAE) test result of an overall band score of at least 147 based on the four test components of speaking, reading, writing and listening and the test must have been taken on or after 1 January 2015. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
- A positive assessment by an Adult Migrant English Program service provider in Australia that you have functional English.
A positive assessment by an Adult Migrant English Program service provider in Australia that you have functional English.
- Completed all years of primary education and at least three years of secondary education in an educational institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English.
Completed all years of primary education and at least three years of secondary education in an educational institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English.
- Completed at least five years of secondary education in an institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English.
Completed at least five years of secondary education in an institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English.
- Successfully completed at least one year of full-time study or equivalent part-time study towards a degree, higher degree, diploma, or associate diploma in an institution in Australia and all instructions were in English.
Successfully completed at least one year of full-time study or equivalent part-time study towards a degree, higher degree, diploma, or associate diploma in an institution in Australia and all instructions were in English.
- Completed a degree, a higher degree, a diploma or a trade certificate that required at least two years of full-time study or training in an institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English.
Completed a degree, a higher degree, a diploma or a trade certificate that required at least two years of full-time study or training in an institution in or outside Australia and all instructions were in English.
- The functional level of the Australian Assessment of Communicative English Skills (ACCESS) test certified by the relevant testing body. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.
The functional level of the Australian Assessment of Communicative English Skills (ACCESS) test certified by the relevant testing body. Your test must have been completed within 12 months of visa application lodgement or can be completed during visa application processing.

### How long your visa lasts

How long your visa lasts
Details

If you are outside Australia when the visa is granted, you will need to enter Australia by a specified date. The visa is usually valid for four years from the date specified for your first entry to Australia.

If you are outside Australia when the visa is granted, you will need to enter Australia by a specified date. The visa is usually valid for four years from the date specified for your first entry to Australia.

### What your visa lets you do

What your visa lets you do
Details

This visa allows you and any family members who have been granted this visa to:

This visa allows you and any family members who have been granted this visa to:
- live, work and study in Australia
live, work and study in Australia
- apply for permanent residence (if you are eligible)
apply for permanent residence (if you are eligible)
- travel in and out of Australia any number of times as long as the visa is valid.
travel in and out of Australia any number of times as long as the visa is valid.

You cannot access Medicare, family assistance or social security benefits.

You cannot access Medicare, family assistance or social security benefits.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You might also need to comply with the following conditions:

You might also need to comply with the following conditions:
- If condition 8515 is attached to your visa you must not marry or enter into a de facto relationship before you enter Australia
If condition 8515 is attached to your visa you must not marry or enter into a de facto relationship before you enter Australia
- If condition 8502 is attached to your visa you must not enter Australia before the person specified has entered Australia.
If condition 8502 is attached to your visa you must not enter Australia before the person specified has entered Australia.

#### Business Owner, State/Territory Sponsored Business Owner, Senior Executive and State/Territory Sponsored Senior Executive provisional visa holders

Business Owner, State/Territory Sponsored Business Owner, Senior Executive and State/Territory Sponsored Senior Executive provisional visa holders
Details

You need to provide valuable input into the Australian economy. You must:

You need to provide valuable input into the Australian economy. You must:
- obtain and maintain substantial ownership interest in a business in Australia
obtain and maintain substantial ownership interest in a business in Australia
- participate, at a senior level, in the day-to-day management and decision-making of that business.
participate, at a senior level, in the day-to-day management and decision-making of that business.

In the business, it is expected that you will do at least one of the following:

In the business, it is expected that you will do at least one of the following:
- develop business links with international markets
develop business links with international markets
- create or maintain employment in Australia
create or maintain employment in Australia
- export Australian goods
export Australian goods
- produce goods or services that would otherwise be imported
produce goods or services that would otherwise be imported
- introduce new or improved technology
introduce new or improved technology
- add to commercial activity and competitiveness within the Australian economy.
add to commercial activity and competitiveness within the Australian economy.

A failure to meet these obligations while holding a Business Skills (Provisional) visa may impact adversely upon any late application for a Business Skills (Residence) visa.

A failure to meet these obligations while holding a Business Skills (Provisional) visa may impact adversely upon any late application for a Business Skills (Residence) visa.

Holders of these visas may be asked to complete a monitoring survey to provide us with information about any business activities undertaken in Australia. This assists in reporting on outcomes of the Business Skills category.

Holders of these visas may be asked to complete a monitoring survey to provide us with information about any business activities undertaken in Australia. This assists in reporting on outcomes of the Business Skills category.

#### Investor and State/Territory Investor visa holders

Investor and State/Territory Investor visa holders
Details

Applicants for Investor visas must maintain their Designated Investment for a four year term. Failure to do so may result in visa cancellation.

Applicants for Investor visas must maintain their Designated Investment for a four year term. Failure to do so may result in visa cancellation.

Holders of these visas may be asked to complete a monitoring survey to provide us with information about any business activities undertaken in Australia. This assists in reporting on outcomes of the Business Skills category.
